intro: Linguella clavigera, commonly known as the sword fern, is a species of fern characterized by its sword-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to various regions in the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizome is creeping and produces numerous roots, which help anchor it to substrates. The fronds are biennial, with the fertile ones appearing in the second year and producing spores on the underside.
